alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 2:31AM PDT until July 14 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low lying areas around Humboldt Bay. High tide is predicted to be 8.4 feet at the North Spit tide gauge near 10 PM Monday evening, and tidal anomalies have been running up to 0.6 foot above predicted values. Minor flooding is possible when tide levels reach 8.8 feet. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 1 AM PDT Thursday.. . * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT.
